title: Ratio of government expenditure to gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Mexico 2024
yAxis: Ratio of government expenditure to GDP
summary: In general Ratio of government expenditure to GDP has fallen over the Year.

Ratio of government expenditure to GDP is gradually decreasing from 2016 to 2017, roughly constant from 2017 to 2019, slightly decreasing from 2019 to 2020, and finally roughly constant from 2020 to 2024.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2016 and 2017.
Maximum Ratio of government expenditure to GDP, about 27.37 was reported at Year 2016
Minimum Ratio of government expenditure to GDP about 24.67 was reached at Year 2021

mid_summary: Overall Ratio of government expenditure to GDP has decreased over the Year.

The most drastic decrease took place within the Year 2016 and 2017.
Maximum Ratio of government expenditure to GDP, about 27.37 was reported at Year 2016
